Ken Wilbur spectrum of consciousness
the Quest for Spiritual Enlightenment
has been an enduring Pursuit throughout
human history countless Seekers across
various cultures and traditions have
sought to transcend the limitations of
The Human Condition and experience a
profound Awakening to the deeper
dimensions of existence spiritual
enlightenment is a profound and
multifaceted experience that transcends
the boundaries of religious doctrines
dogmas it entails a radical shift in
Consciousness an Awakening to the
ultimate nature of reality and a
profound recognition of one's
interconnectedness with all of existence
throughout history numerous spiritual
Traditions have offered diverse paths
practices and philosophies to facilitate
this transformational journey there are
however real pitifuls and dangers along
the path in the past the Journey of a
spiritual Seeker was often ardious and
filled with challenges when it came to
attaining teachings
Seekers had severely limited access to
spiritual teachings which were primarily
passed down through overall Traditions
while written texts were extremely
scarce Seekers often had to travel great
distances through extremely dangerous
lands to find enlightened teachers
obtaining and retaining sacred texts
required painstaking efforts of
transcription and preservation today's
digital age has transformed the
spiritual seeking landscape dramatically
the internet and the proliferation of
Technology have made it remarkably easy
for Spiritual Seekers to access a vast
array of teachings a wealth of spiritual
wisdom from different Traditions is now
just a few clicks away this easy access
to profound spiritual teachings is not
without its drawbacks misunderstandings
and confusion particularly in the west
the cultural setting for a real
understanding of the deep profundity of
the enlightened State and what it is
required to realize it does not match
the now easy availability of the
descriptions of it often two and
understand ending of the relationship
between spiritual stages and states is
missing or not understood this can be a
major drawback all kinds of States
including the highest and most subtle
States can be intuited even deeply
intuited by anyone at any time however
it is the stages of development firstly
as a grounding in human development and
then subsequently Spiritual Development
which allows for a perspective that
determines whether one can one recognize
the state and two stabilize and remain
in that state
the seven stages of life
there have been numerous models of human
and Spiritual Development offered by
spiritual Traditions east and west and
from the 1900s onwards by Western
Psychiatric and psychological theorists
one of the very first developmental
models in the west that included both
eastern and western theoretics was a
spectrum of Consciousness by Ken Wilbur
the book published in 1977 when Wilbur
was 23 years old had a massive impact in
spiritual and transpersonal Circles by
1985 by which time Wilbur had published
four more influential books Wilbur was
being called the Einstein of
Consciousness shortly after this however
Wilbur strongly endorsed the teachings
of the American spiritual teacher de
free John now known as Adidas at the
risk to his intellectual reputation
Wilbur effusively praised Adidas written
teachings and in particular the human
and spiritual developmental model which
Adidas called the seven stages of life
regardless of how one might respond to
the rest of Adidas teaching is 7 stages
of life does offer an excellent way of
mapping the stages of human and
Spiritual Development by briefly
outlining these stages we can utilize a
model in which we can firstly recognize
spiritual States and secondly recognize
how we can get stuck in certain States
or conversely be pulled out of spiritual
states by unfinished human or spiritual
developmental stages the seven stages of
Life Maps the natural unfolding of human
development from birth to Enlightenment
the first three stages typically cover
the first 21 years of Our Lives first
stage zero to seven years old this is a
time of individuation where children
separate from their mothers and develop
a conscious connection with others and
nature signs of completing this stage
include individuation socialization Corp
operation and sensitivity to Nature
second stage 7 to 14 years old
during this stage we developed
sensitivity to the energetic dimension
of existence including our relationships
with others and nature completing this
stage involves responsible and positive
interactions with others third stage 14
to 21 years this stage focuses on
adapting to the psychic dimension of
existence and developing our will
thinking mind and psyche completion of
this stage means being physically
emotionally ethically and mentally
prepared with enough energy and
attention free from the preoccupations
of money food or sex to begin genuine
spiritual practice the spiritual stages
begin with the fourth stage and lead to
Enlightenment the fourth stage is a
practice of surrendering our sense of
separate self to higher power whether we
call it Consciousness Source or God it
serves as the foundation for the stages
that follow and it is important to note
that the transformation occurs in the
body and mind not just the Mind alone as
we deepen our surrender we may
experience emotional and psychic signs
indicating the opening of our psychic
Dimension this marks the fifth stage
which is associated with shamans and
shamanistic practices the length of this
stage varies depending on the amount of
psychic material we need to surrender
the sixth stage is when we recognize our
true identity as Source Consciousness or
God after purifying ourselves through
surrender we can stably abide in this
realization the seventh stage involves
overcoming the mistake of exclusively
identifying ourselves with Souls
Consciousness or God while excluding the
world of appearances in this stage both
ourselves and the world are recognized
as manifestations of the same Divine
reality the seventh stage known as sahaj
samadhi or open eyes
recognizes all seeming appearances as
nothing but pure Radiance a state where
everything is perceived as the radiant
expression of the Divine the vast
majority of people remain stuck in the
first three stages of life for their
entire lives there is much on offer on
the internet and Elsewhere on how one
may achieve Optimum functionality in
these first three stages of life however
this advice is given not to free oneself
for Spiritual practice and for higher
stages of life but rather to achieve
maximum productivity to enjoy the fruits
of life in other words to become
successful in the marketplace
